name: Hotel Prince Albert Louvre

reviews.text: This hotel is one of the worst hotels that I have ever stayed. Their rooms are much worse than the photos on the web. The rooms are very small and dirty. The furniture is very very old. The bathrooms are terrible (I stayed at 2 different rooms in this hotel). One person can hardly walk into the bathroom and the whole room is flooded when you shower. The internet does not work. On top of these, the hotel staff are also terrible. On the third day of my stay my room was not even cleaned. I left early in the morning for some sightseeing and came back to the hotel in the evening hours to see that the room was not cleaned and the bathroom was still flooded. The receptionist said that it was not his problem! When I checked out early after all of these, the receptionist charged me for one full day for a room that they had not even bothered to clean! Stay away from this hotel. It ruined my Paris vacation.
reviews.title: worst hotel ever

reviews.text: Prince Albert hotel is superbly located only 10 minutes walk to the Louvre, Tuileries gardens, Place Vendome, Opera and the Seine. Its in a very quiet lane with very little noise at night. My room was tiny with dated decor, but adequate. The bathroom was spacious and very modern. the hotel breakfast was good. Desk staff were very helpful, informative and friendly. As a woman travelling on my own, I felt quite safe in this area coming home at night.
reviews.title: Location, location in Paris

reviews.text: Very convenient location close to shops, restaurants and museums and the Metro. Free wifi. Rooms are small and dated, although the bathroom was recently upgraded. The air-conditioning was not working, but thank goodness the weather was cool. Guess it's the price to pay for that location...
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: I stayed at Prince Albert in June 2012. Staff was very helpful and friendly. I booked single room but I was proposed to occupy double. So I stayed in double room with no extra charge. Location is extreemly good - just opposite to the Tuileries gardens. 2 minutes walk from Louvre and 5 minutes walk from Concorde. Easy to get to any place of interest located in the centre. There are a lot of nice cafe near Opera. Easy to get from airport. Roisybus goes to Opera station and it takes about 5 minutes walk from Opera to the Hotel. Free wi-fi with good speed.
reviews.title: Excellent location, helpful staff

reviews.text: Room was small but was cleaned every day with enough quality. Building is old and you can easily hear what is happenning in other rooms but it's quite common case for Europe.
reviews.title: Solid, workmanlike hotel with great location and great staff

reviews.text: You couldn't ask for a better location. Quiet, but still amazingly central for the Louvre, Tuileries and (quite) a few great bars. Breakfast is good, shower is hot and plentiful, yes the rooms are small, but comfortable.
reviews.title: Great location, friendly staff

reviews.text: The hotel is motorcycle friendly, and there is designated parking on the street outside, or do as I did, prebook parking on Pyramides and just stroll around the corner to the hotel. The lift is tiny - but amusing when you try to fit people, motorcycle gear, and helmets in :-). Staff are helpful and friendly.
reviews.title: Central location , walk to the Louvre

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This lovely hotel is just a short block off Rivoli St and 10 min walk to the Louvre. Breakfast was included. The tour agency is very close on Rivoli where I went at 8 am for a day tour. The metro station is an easy walk too. My room was tiny but all I needed, clean and tidy with a lift .The staff were very helpful and 24 hour desk.Free internet in the lobby.
reviews.title: A great wee find in a fantastic location
good location in Paris
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here during the weekend of the Tour de France. The location was fantastic, just 2-3 minute walk from both Pyramides and Tuileries. It is also located about 5 minutes walk from the Louvre, so great for sight seeing.

The room we stayed in, whilst looking slightly tired in terms of the age of the furniture, was very clean and comfortable. Money has obviously been spent on the bathroom, which was immaculate, with a great, powerful shower. Staff were also very friendly throughout our stay.
reviews.title: Location, location, location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2 blocks from the Louvre! Right off the metro!
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: After flying 11 hours you need a nice quite hotel to decompress thats easy to get to without suprises. Going to Paris then this is the Hotel, at the right priced, nice room with a newly remodeled bathroom. We had a street side room 5th floor that was quite! There staff was fantastic and there breakfast was ok (don't come for the breakfast) A little tuff to book so book early!
reviews.title: Nice and sentral

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were a group of 6 staying at this hotel this july. Our room was nice and big with A/C and remote control :), the bathroom was excellent. The rest of the group were not so lucky, their rooms really needed some renovation.
reviews.title: As expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff at the hotel was very helpful and friendly.
reviews.title: You get what you expect

reviews.text: The breakfast at the hotel was not worth the money, get some breakfast at one of the cafe´s instead. All in all a ok and centrally located hotel worth the money .
reviews.title: Near to Louvre and Subway, location as a convinent hotel on Wangfujing Street

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The one thing I can't complain about this the location. Close to the major tourist attractions, shopping, restaurants, etc.
reviews.title: Great location, hotel dated and the room not the cleanest.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was extremely disappointed with the condition of the room. Very dated and I didn't find it clean. Bathroom had mold on the floor, tub and ceiling. The tub needed a good scrubbing. Something else I found unpleasant was the bed pillows. They didn't have a pillow cover over them and they were covered in drewl from previous guests - yuck. The room had what you call a courtyard view. All you look at is another wall - don't be mislead, there is nothing appealing with the view. Room didn't have A/C and there wasn't even a fan. The only air you would get is from the window that overlooks the courtyard. If you left you window open anyone else staying on the first floor could go out their window and into your room. Would leave the room in the morning and locked the window. You come back later in the day and the cleaning staff, if you can call them that, would open the window leaving your valuables open to being stolen.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although the price is good at this hotel spend the extra money and find a better hotel. Do lots of research on your hotel prior to booking so you won't be as disappointed as I was.
reviews.title: Great location, fab holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 4 nights at this hotel and we walked everywhere- Louvre (5-10 min), Champs Elysees, Arc d'Triomphe, Musee d'Orsay etc. Two Metro stops (Tuilieries & Pyramides) close by too.
reviews.title: Cosy Place and Great Location!

likes.disliked: — Have to hand in room key to front desk everytime you leave hotel

reviews.text: Rooms small but functional. Nice to have AC & fridge in room. Internet (in the lobby) is 1.50Euro for 15 minutes. Great cafe 1/2 block away for breakfast - 4.50Euro for cafe latte, croissant and fresh OJ. there is also a nice organic cafe/bakery around the corner that we found on the last day! Farmers Market on saturday 1/2 block from hotel.
reviews.title: Perfect location at Prince Albert Louvre

likes.liked: — location, value for money, great staff at front desk, slightly wacky decor
likes.disliked: — Cramped bathrooms and lack of air con

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As others have said, it's hard to beat this hotel for location being a short walk from the Louvre, the Opera and Place de la Concorde.
reviews.title: Location, location, location
EXCELENT LOCATION IN PARIS
reviews.text: The rooms are typically French, which is to say small and reached via a narrow and winding corridor or via a tiny lift. If you prefer a 'standard' (which is to say bland and featureless) hotel room then I'm sure the Holiday Inn will help you out. But the room was clean and comfortable, which is pretty much all I look for in a Paris room - we're only there as a place to sleep.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff seemed fine; happy to help when asked, and happy to let us leave bags behind for half a day after checking out. The nearest metro station is Tuileries, which isn't ideal because you're nearly always going to have to change to get somewhere useful but if you stay here then you'll walk to a lot of the main attractions anyway.
reviews.title: Great location, basic hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I give this an above average rating only because of its location. You can walk to all the main attractions Louvre, Notre Dame, Eiffel tower and boat trips are right there. Lots of eating places.
reviews.title: Good central location, not the greatest room
Wonderful Location...
reviews.text: The downer is the room. It was clean but very small and the lift could only squeeze 2 people in. The service was very good and the man at reception was very helpfull. So apart from the small room, I would definately recommend it.

This was an excellent place to stay. Very close to most main attractions and on a very quiet street. The restaurants surrounding it are a little expensive, but very nice. The room was kept very clean and the staff was extraordinarily nice. The room was very large for European standards. I would absolutely say here again.
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel

reviews.text: First stay in this hotel booked for two nights. My single room was one of the smallest hotelrooms I ever stayed in (I compared it with rooms I stayed in at Palmerhouse Hilton , Chicago on previous trips). The room was quiete and clean which is very important to me, room was outdated, but the bathroom was pretty nice. The location is just great, close to Louvre, Palais Royale, musée des arts décoratifs and top notch shopping areas such as rue St. Honoré.
reviews.title: Excellent location, in a quite street

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff is very friendly and helpfull, my special thanks to Hamid , an employee who knows what service means!
reviews.title: Location makes up for the simple room

reviews.text: In Paris, location is everything. This hotel is very well situated, on a quiet street but close by the Place du Marché St Honoré, with excellent restaurants. Because of its central location, you can walk to most shopping areas, attractions etcetera
reviews.title: Convenient location for Central Paris

reviews.text: Writing this review, I'm taking into account that good value, centrally located hotels are a hard find in Paris. The rooms in this hotel are very small, but comfortable enough considering the price paid. I've had lots of hotels who asked higher prices for lesser rooms. The decor of the bathroom is nice, but they didn't pay much attention to detail and finishing. the decor of the room itself was pretty dated. The hotel offers free wifi, which worked well. Reception was nice and helpfull. We didn't have breakfast in the hotel. There's much cheaper options close by, at Place du Marché St. Honoré for instance.
reviews.title: Superb location, especially for short stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I have stayed at the Prince Albert Louvre twice in the last year. The hotel is a five minute walk from tuilleries stop on the No. 1 Metro Line, so from the airport you can be in your hotel room in less than an hour on public transport.
reviews.title: You cant get a better location in paris!!

likes.liked: — Friendliness and cleanliness and great breakfast

reviews.text: Rooms on both trips have been compact, with the 'pod' bathrooms which seemed unsatisfactory at first. HOWEVER, once you have been there a day or so you realise that this is a well run, very clean and friendly hotel, and the bathrooms are fine. Mourad on reception is a very genial host and the manager, always happy to help and direct you, and order tickets for shows etc. On the corner of the street is a classic parisian bar with a vintage zinc counter. This closes at 10pm but is worth a look in. Within 5 mins walk you have restaurants of really good quality, offering fixed price and a la carte. Also within 5 mins walk is the impressive place vendome, where the RITZ hotel is located, also nearby is the Garnier Opera house and the Louvre Museum. If you walk a little further, says 20 mins, you can go to the big shops on boulevard housemann or cross the river and go to the musee d'orsay which is superb.
reviews.title: Perfect Location

reviews.text: If you have a choice we would suggest a room on the street side, as the rooms at the rear face an enclosed courtyard which can echo when people walk through. This said, for the money, I would recommend this hotel highly. If you contact direct you may even save money over the internet prices.
reviews.title: Good Value, Great Location
Small and friendly
reviews.text: Hello there. As far as this hotel you are paying for location, and not much I may add. I paid 64 euro per nite. If you are an American and have never been to Europe read this carefully. The hotel is very old and the rooms and hallways are extremely small, I had a single room with no air conditioning and a bathroom that was inserted (for lack of a better explanation). But, the staff was very friendly, breakfast in the morning was not much for the price, 7 euro, but I dont have a big breakfast and I ate there our of convenience. CNN was the on English speaking TV channel. Most of the prior reviews seemed to be right on. I did not spend much time in the room. McDonalds was close by also. I was satisfied because I only needed a cheap place to sleep, which was just what this hotel is.
We were looking for someplace super convenient for the last night of our trip. The price was right and the location fit the bill.
reviews.title: Great!
A find
reviews.text: Got this hotel on a last minute reservations site for a steal. I wanted to stay someplace central but I didn't want to break the bank as I was on vacation rather than business. This hotel is situated in a fabulous neighbourhood within walking distance of all the action. The staff themselves are incredibly polite and accommodating, nothing was too much trouble. The room was small with antique furniture but I had a small balcony and all of this just added to the charm. I can't say anything about the breakfast as I got up too late to have it. I would certainly be back to stay here when travelling to Paris for leisure. For the price it's a bargain, though I wouldn't pay more than EUR80 a room for it.

reviews.title: Prince Albert Louvre Hotel - Nice but small!!
reviews.text: I recently stayed at the Prince Albert Louvre and, although it was cute, I would not go back. The hotel has a great location - 1 block off Rue St. Honore (with cafes, designer shops) and a 5 min walk to the Louvre (beautiful!). But... the hotel was tiny and very in your face, like Paris was, actually. I liked Paris, but it's very, very polite and, well, French. The hotel had about 4 desk staffers, and all were very nice, except one who, literally would not initially give me my key until I said my room # en francais! I, of course, had been walking for, like, 4 hours and my years of high school French were in the back of my brain. I simply stared at the man and he told it to me and gave me my key. Later, when I returned, I obliged him, but oh my! This hotel also makes you give them your key EVERY time you leave. Ugghhh. For a very independant, quiet person like me, this was not enjoyable. But, they were mostly friendly.

Also, the rooms were small. Mine was beyond tiny. Paris was a treat, for the most part. Great shopping and pretty good food. Try the four-cheese pizzas found in many cafes. The hotel was decent - if you like socializing and a very involved management, try this hotel!
reviews.title: Fantastic Location

reviews.text: Cassy, Atlanta, GA
reviews.title: Very good

reviews.text: This hotel was in a the perfect location in central Paris.
reviews.title: Two Star but good value and friendly .

description: 19th Century building, charming, very well located - Financial and shopping area, Opera and Louvre Museum all nearby.
